intro: Rhus eylesii, commonly known as the Eyles' sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like poison ivy and cashew. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several narrow, pointed leaflets. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in upright clusters, followed by red, fuzzy fruits that attract birds and other wildlife. Rhus eylesii is often found in moist, open woods and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sun.
